briefTitle: Safety and Efficacy of Difluprednate 0.05% for the Treatment of Anterior Uveitis
officialTitle: A Phase 3 Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Masked Study of the Safety and Efficacy of Difluprednate 0.05% Ophthalmic Emulsion Compared to Prednisolone Acetate 1% Ophthalmic Suspension in the Treatment of Endogenous Anterior Uveitis
summary: The purpose of this study was to demonstrate that difluprednate 0.05% (Durezol) dosed 4 times daily is noninferior to prednisolone 1% (Pred Forte) dosed 8 times daily for the treatment of endogenous anterior uveitis.

primaryOutcome.measure: Change From Baseline (Day 0) in Anterior Chamber Cell Grade at Day 14
